items.title: Canada's Indigenous veterans faced tough battles — abroad and at home
items.summary_auto: Canada marks Indigenous Veterans Day on Saturday, shining a spotlight on wartime experiences that historian Scott Sheffield says was a place where some would find a sense of belonging, away from racism at home.

items.title: Toronto children’s charity wins big following Jays-Dodgers rivalry
items.summary_auto: Los Angeles Dodgers fans donated $30,000 to Toronto’s SickKids Hospital following their team’s World Series win — picking up a trend Toronto Blue Jays fans started during their post-season run.

items.title: After fuel spill in B.C. lake, early tests show no contamination above drinking water guidelines
items.summary_auto: B.C. officials say that preliminary tests show no contamination above drinking water guidelines after 80,000 litres of fuel was spilled into Kamloops Lake following a train derailment.

items.title: Maltos Diaz sends Alouettes to Grey Cup with game-winning kick over Ticats
items.summary_auto: Jose Maltos Diaz and the Montreal Alouettes are Grey Cup bound. Diaz's 45-yard field goal on the game's final play gave Montreal an exciting 19-16 East Division final win over the Hamilton Tiger-Cats on Saturday.

items.title: Trailer Park Boys actor Mike Smith charged with sexual assault
items.summary_auto: Mike Smith, the actor famous for playing Bubbles on Trailer Park Boys, has been charged with sexual assault in relation to an alleged 2017 incident in Dartmouth.

items.title: Discount grocery stores gaining momentum in Quebec
items.summary_auto: A new kind of grocery store is selling discounted food items, sometimes that are near or past their ‘best before’ date to promise cheaper prices for customers. CBC’s Gabriel Guinty shares more on the story.

items.title: Grounded container ship MSC Baltic III damaged by 'extreme wind' and rough seas
items.summary_auto: Crews are assessing the damage to the container ship, grounded off Newfoundland's west coast since February.

items.title: Tornado in Brazil kills 6, injures hundreds
items.summary_auto: A tornado accompanied by strong winds and heavy rain struck the southern Brazilian state of Parana, killing six people, the state government said on Saturday. The town of Rio Bonito do Iguaçu was hit hardest late Friday.

items.title: UPS, FedEx ground MD-11 air cargo fleets after deadly Louisville, Ky., crash
items.summary_auto: United Parcel Service and FedEx said on Friday they have grounded their combined fleet of more than 50 McDonnell Douglas MD-11 cargo planes following a crash in Louisville, Ky., this week that killed at least 14 people.

items.title: Vancouver Rise advance to inaugural Northern Super League final after shootout win over Rapid
items.summary_auto: The Vancouver Rise are heading to the inaugural Northern Super League final after defeating the Ottawa Rapid in a shootout Saturday.

items.title: An Alberta general strike raises many questions. Key among them are if — and when
items.summary_auto: What are the legalities around a general strike? What moves could the Alberta government take to stop it? And if it does go ahead, when should it happen?

items.title: Tanzania police seek to arrest opposition leaders after protests
items.summary_auto: African Union observers said the vote was not credible and that they had documented ballot box stuffing. The government has dismissed criticism of the process and said the election was fair.

items.title: Mystery illness has Manitoba parents seeking genetic answers in Florida
items.summary_auto: Only a week after Beau Friesen was born, his parents knew something was wrong, but two years later, they still don't know what. Now, the Grunthal, Man., family is going to Florida to see a genetics expert in search of answers.

items.title: Halifax's role in the most important WW II mission you never heard of
items.summary_auto: Operation Fish was a secret mission that would see Halifax play a key role in ensuring Britain's success in the war.

items.title: 3 Sask. men reflect on Indigenous Veterans Day
items.summary_auto: Three First Nations men from Saskatchewan who served in the Canadian Armed Forces say National Indigenous Veterans Day on Nov. 8 is a time to reflect.

items.title: Why Trump’s battle with U.S. mayors might hurt everyone, even him
items.summary_auto: New York City mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani is another Democratic mayor in an acrimonious relationship with U.S. President Donald Trump. But observers say these relationships matter and can impact both those mayors' cities and Trump's political ambitions.

items.title: Victims of Ottawa mass stabbing remembered at murderer's guilty plea
items.summary_auto: Thursday's guilty plea and sentencing of one of Ottawa's worst mass murderers brought a conclusive end to a dismal chapter in the capital's history, but it was also a time to remember the victims and the families they've left behind.

items.title: Why do pregnancy, breastfeeding reduce risk of breast cancer? Latest science finds clues
items.summary_auto: Breastfeeding and childbirth have long been known to reduce the risk of breast cancer. Now medical researchers are gaining clues on why, and hoping these insights could lead to treatments to mimic the protective effects of nursing.

items.title: IN PHOTOS | This week's most compelling images
items.summary_auto: Photographers from CBC News, The Canadian Press, Reuters and others document our changing world every day. Here's a selection of the week's top images.

items.title: Why your booze-free drink costs just as much as the alcoholic kind
items.summary_auto: You might skip the alcohol, but you won’t skip the price tag. Here’s why booze-free drinks cost almost as much as the real thing.

items.title: Niagara family, mayor call for hotelier Jimmy Lai's release from Hong Kong prison as G7 ministers set to meet
items.summary_auto: As G7 foreign ministers prepare to meet in Ontario's Niagara Region, family of hotel owner Jimmy Lai and Niagara-on-the-Lake’s lord mayor are calling for the pro-democracy activist's release from a Hong Kong prison. "I would love for my cousins to be able to just hug their dad before he dies," his niece told CBC News.

items.title: How the woman who wasn't allowed to play built a future for Canadian hockey
items.summary_auto: Danièle Sauvageau, the girl who grew up in Deux-Montanges, Que., and wasn’t allowed to play on an organized hockey team because she wasn’t a boy, is now the first woman 'Builder' inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame.

items.title: It's not easy being a Black immigrant woman in Atlantic Canada
items.summary_auto: Chef, actor, writer and entrepreneur Angeletta McKenzie writes about her struggles moving from Jamaica to St. John's, and how she learned to make space for herself and other immigrants.

items.title: Victims of Ottawa mass stabbing remembered at killer's guilty plea
items.summary_auto: Thursday's guilty plea and sentencing of one of Ottawa's worst mass murderers brought a conclusive end to a dismal chapter in the capital's history, but it was also a time to remember the victims and the families they've left behind.

items.title: A City of Oshawa tree caused sewage to back up in this woman’s home. But the region won’t cover plumbing costs
items.summary_auto: An Oshawa woman is warning other homeowners after Durham Region declined to cover $1,600 in plumbing costs caused by a city-owned tree, citing a bylaw.

items.title: Hundreds more U.S. flights could be cancelled today. Here’s what you need to know
items.summary_auto: Hundreds of flights have been cancelled across the U.S. this week — with more expected in the coming days — as airlines comply with a mandated reduction in service due to the ongoing government shutdown.
